data.title: Margaret Ann (Siddall) Cooper (1882-1963)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Margaret (Siddall) Cooper born 1882 Regent Road, Salford, Lancashire, England, United Kingdom died 1963 Trail, Kootenay Boundary Regional District, British Columbia, Canada including ancestors + descendants + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 7 Apr 2024 | Created 7 Feb 2024

This page has been accessed 41 times.

Biography

This profile is part of the Cooper Name Study.

This profile is part of the Siddle Name Study.

Margaret Ann Siddall was born on August 21, 1882 in Regent Road, Salford, Lancashire, England, United Kingdom, daughter of James Siddle (1854–1907) and Ann Coupland (1856–1907).[1] She was baptized on September 1, 1882.[1]

In 1891, Margaret Ann (8) was a daughter in the household of James Siddall (36) in Salford registration district in Lancashire, England. [2]

In 1901, Margt (18) was a daughter in the household of James Siddall (50) in Salford registration district in Lancashire, England. [3]

Margaret (20) married John James Cooper (23) (born on January 10, 1879 in Patricroft, Lancashire; son of John Cooper and Mary Ann (Williams) Cooper) on August 28, 1902 in Salford, Christchurch.[4] Their children were:

Doris Ethel Cooper (1903–2000)

John James Cooper (1906–1971)

Albert Cooper (1908–1960)

Margaret Hazel Cooper (1911–2000)

Annie Cooper (1914–2008)

Arthur Cooper (1916–1986)

Cora Alice Cooper (1922–2005)

In 1906, Margaret Cooper (24), married in Alberta. [5]

In 1911, Margaret Cooper (28), was a wife, in the household of John Cooper (32) in Arrow Park, British Columbia. [6]

In 1921, Margaret Cooper (39), was a wife, in the household of John Cooper (41) at 288 Polling Division 14, Kootenay West, Polling Division 14, British Columbia, Canada. [7]

In 1931, Margaret Annie Cooper (48), was a wife, Homemaker, in the household of John James Cooper (53) in Silverton, British Columbia, Canada. [8]

Margaret died on August 23, 1963 in Trail, Kootenay Boundary Regional District, British Columbia, Canada, aged 81. She was buried in New Denver Village Cemetery, New Denver, Central Kootenay Regional District, British Columbia.[9] [10]

Fact: Residence (1891) Salford, Lancashire, England

Fact: Residence (31 Mar 1901) Salford, Lancashire, England

Fact: Immigration (1905)

Fact: Residence (1911) Kootenay Sub-Districts 1-61, British Columbia, Canada

Fact: Burial New Denver, Central Kootenay Regional District, British Columbia, Canada
